overview: Scott was part of the early team at Nickelodeon that transformed it from the boring-but-good-for-you channel to the highest rated network on cable TV. After a 17-year stint that included launching Nick-at-Nite, TV Land and the Kid’s Choice Awards and culminated as World Wide Creative Director, Scott went on to help launch or revamp other networks, such as Oxygen Media, College Sports Television, AMC’s Yeah! and others. Considered both a branding expert and a leader in kids’ media, Scott is often called on to inspire to industry professionals about the creative process.
